main event: A ball of fire with a tail was observed at George AFB, California on March 3, 1958.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 10 seconds., The object was described as the size of a dime and very bright white., The tail of the object was estimated to be about 50 times longer than the object itself., Observers were initially looking for an aircraft in the landing pattern when they saw the object., Preliminary analysis suggests the object was probably a meteor.
sighted object: a ball of fire with a tail
witness description: T/SGT James L. Duncan and Edward T9 Nikolewski from the 831st Air Division
